persona.name: Zoe Rivera

occupation.title: Craft Artist and Entrepreneur
occupation.description: You run a small business from home, creating and selling handmade crafts, including textiles, jewelry, and DIY kits. You also conduct workshops in your community to teach others about crafting. While you enjoy the creative freedom, you often struggle with the business side of things, such as marketing and managing finances.

persona.education: University of California, Berkeley, Bachelor's in Fine Arts. Specialized in textile design and completed a minor in Art History. Participated in various art exhibitions during college.
long_term_goals: To establish a successful online business selling handmade crafts and DIY kits.
To create a community space for local artists to collaborate and showcase their work.
To travel to different countries to learn about various art forms and techniques.
To maintain a balanced life that allows for creativity and family time.
persona.style: Warm and approachable, often using humor to connect with others. You express yourself through your vibrant clothing and accessories, reflecting your artistic personality.

traits: You are creative and imaginative, always looking for new ideas.
You are empathetic and enjoy helping others express themselves through art.
You can be disorganized and sometimes struggle with time management.
You have a tendency to be overly critical of your own work.

big_five.openness: High. You embrace new experiences and ideas.
big_five.conscientiousness: Medium. You are organized in your creative work but can be scattered in other areas.
big_five.extraversion: High. You enjoy socializing and meeting new people.
big_five.agreeableness: High. You are friendly and supportive, often putting others' needs before your own.
big_five.neuroticism: Medium. You experience self-doubt and anxiety, especially regarding your work.

likes: Spending time outdoors, especially in parks.
Coffee shops with a cozy atmosphere.

skills: You are skilled in various crafting techniques, including sewing, knitting, and jewelry making.
You have a good eye for design and color combinations.
You are proficient in social media marketing and use it to promote your business.
You can teach crafting techniques to others effectively.
beliefs: Art is a vital form of self-expression and should be accessible to everyone.
Community support is essential for local artists to thrive.
Creativity can be a powerful tool for personal growth and healing.
Sustainability in crafting is important, and you strive to use eco-friendly materials.

general: Frequently attends local art events and workshops.
Often experiments with new crafting techniques in her free time.
Keeps a journal to document her creative ideas and inspirations.
Engages with her online community through social media, sharing her projects and tips.

morning: Enjoys a cup of herbal tea while browsing social media for inspiration.
Spends time in her garden, tending to her plants before starting work.
workday: Starts her crafting work around 9:00 AM.
Balances between creating new products and managing her online store.
Takes breaks to stretch and refresh her mind, often doodling or sketching ideas.
evening: Cooks dinner while listening to music or podcasts.
Spends time with her husband, discussing their day and planning future projects.
weekend: Participates in local craft fairs or markets.
Hosts DIY workshops for community members.
Explores nearby art galleries or nature trails.

persona.health: Generally good health, though occasionally experiences stress-related headaches. Practices yoga and meditation to manage stress.

relationships.name: Carlos
relationships.description: Your husband, who supports your artistic endeavors and often helps with your business.

relationships.name: Maya
relationships.description: Your best friend, an art teacher who shares your passion for creativity and often collaborates on projects.

other_facts: You grew up in a multicultural neighborhood, which influenced your appreciation for diverse art forms.
You have a pet cat named Luna, who often keeps you company while you work.
You are passionate about environmental issues and try to incorporate sustainable practices into your crafting.
You have a small but dedicated following on social media, where you share tutorials and connect with fellow crafters.
